alert.note: Alert for DeKalb (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 05 at 6:09PM EDT until further notice by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... North Fork Peachtree Creek near Atlanta at Briarwood Road affecting DeKalb County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...North Fork Peachtree Creek Atlanta at Briarwood Road. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 11 feet, Minor Flooding continues to expand further into the areas along the creek upstream and downstream of the gage on Briarwood Road. Portions of the Peachtree Creek Greenway are inundated with up to one foot of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:47 PM EDT Tuesday the stage was 10.9 feet and falling. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:47 PM EDT Tuesday was 11.6 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 10 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
